pages.text:
Our Story
Welcome to The Beach Theatre, where cinematic nostalgia meets coastal charm. In the heart of downtown St. Pete Beach, Florida, our historic theatre has been a beloved landmark since 1940. As of February 29th 2024, we are under new ownership and plan to reopen in 2025 as a cinema and live performing arts venue!
The Beach Theatre is a historic landmark that was well loved by the beach community. Since closing its doors in 2012, The Beach Theatre sat vacant and took significant damage from the elements. We are under a total renovation including a new screen, audio/visual equipment, seats, AC, roof, and everything in between! We are so excited to welcome you to the new Beach Theatre in 2025! For rental inquiries, email hhockman@thebeachtheatre.org.
“The reopening of The Beach Theatre isn't just about watching movies—it's about celebrating tradition, fostering community, and preserving the magic of nostalgia for generations to come.”
— Hannah Hockman, Director

The Green Flash
September 1st; 5th - 7th
In 1973, six young men and one old shrimper were caught with nine tons of marijuana in the sleepy town of Steinhatchee, Florida. They were brought to justice for what was, at the time, the biggest drug bust in U.S. history. For Steve Lamb, the youngest of the group, this was just the beginning. “The Green Flash” tells his story.
September 5th @ 7PM
September 6th @ 2PM
September 6th 7PM
September 7th @ 1PM
To the friends and family that joined us at The Green Flash on opening night, enjoy the opening night photos here!
